DOC.brief_summary: To determine the effects of upper limb forearm cooling on Essential Tremor upper limb tremor using a more practical method of limb cooling through a forearm cold pack.
DOC.brief_title: Electrophysiological Study of the Effects of Limb Cooling on Essential Tremor
DOC.criteria: Patients with clinical diagnosis of E.T. for at least a year by a movement disorder neurologist A +2 or worse action or kinetic tremor of one or both upper limbs involving at least the forearm and/or hand Ages 18 to 95 years old (+) sensory loss in the upper extremities dermatologic lesions in upper extremities (e.g. skin cancer, eczema, fresh or healing wounds, abrasions, acne, pustules, abscesses, or skin rash) known history of sensitivity to cold (i.e., cold urticaria) known peripheral vascular disease Raynaud's phenomenon scleroderma
DOC.keyword: Patients with Essential Tremor involving the upper limbs with at least moderate tremor.
